result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick D. Smith Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick D. Smith Sr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick D. Smith Sr. was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Patrick D. Smith Sr. was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to Milwaukee County case 10CF4595.
Deft has no sentence credit on this case.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   
*   Pay prosecution costs of $306.00 Joint & Several w/ 14CF563 & 14CF564
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 30 months w/conditions, concurrent on cts 1 & 2 and consecutive to Milwaukee County case 10CF4595; deft has no sentence credit on this case; prosecution costs ordered in the amount of $306.00, joint & several with 14CF564 & 14CF563.
Summary of Itemized statement of other prosecution costs and Petion and Order for other prosecution costs in the amount of $308.00  With Co defts.
From D.A. office regarding additional discovery.
from Elizabeth Dalpaos to Atty Hertz-McGrath
2nd Amended Information.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files 2nd amended information.  On State's motion, ct 3 is dismissed; the repeater enhancer in cts 1 & 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  PSI ordered.  SEH 4/8/16 at 9am.  Bond continued.
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Michael Graveley  kmk

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DDA Graveley states the swab sample was not collected from the deft after the last hearing; states he will arrange to have the sample taken following court today.  Court instructs that the sample is to be taken and sent to the crime lab today.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DDA Graveley states he will be sending firearm and drugs to crime lab for testing.  JSH 12/18/15 at 11am and JS 2/8/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Exhibits kept in file 14CF563 pending resolution of case.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Suppression motion.  Testimony taken from:  KSD Deputy John Lanctot.  Court denies motion to suppress for reasons set forth on the record.  FPT 10/15/15 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On co-deft case Atty Bielski stated he was going to prepare a brief but after reviewing file he does not believe a complete evidentiary record was made; believes testimony needs to be taken.  MH continued to 9/29/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DDA Graveley states there has been a decision in the Houghton case by the US Supreme Court.  Atty McGrath would like a decision on motion brought in this case.  Court to review Houghton decision.  Decision on motion set for 9/11/15 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.

With Elizabeth/DDA Graveley and Fran/Atty McGrath the STC of 6/11/15 at 2:30pm is rescheduled; as they are waiting for the WI Supreme Court to make a decision in the State v. Houghton case which should be out by mid-July; reset to 8/20/15 at 9am.

With Atty McGrath and Elizabeth/ADA Graveley the STC of 4/9/15 at 9am is rescheduled; as the Wisconsin case they are waiting on, Houghton, interpreting the SCOTUS decision in Heien, is being argued on April 22; STC is reset to 6/11/15 at 2:30pm.
With Fran/Atty McGrath and ADA Graveley the STC of 2/6/15 at 10am is rescheduled, as they are still waiting on the Supreme Court deciison; reset to 4/9/15 at 9am.
Westlaw - State v. Houghton

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty McGrath's motion to suppress.  Atty Bielski appeared on co-deft case and stated there has been a petition for a court of appeals review and the US Supreme Court case decision is pending which could affect the Houghton decision; requests to set this case over until the decision is in.  Atty McGrath agrees.  ADA Graveley agrees.  STC set for 2/6/15 at 10am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGraht.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Co-deft from file 14CF563 does not appear.  MH adjourned to 11/10/14 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.  Squad video reviewed off the record separately by parties/Judge.
to suppress physical evidence due to warrantless search of motor vehicle, and miranda rights violations; filed by Atty D Hertz-McGrath.

Atty McGrath states she will be filing a suppression motion.  Court gives Atty McGrath until 9/8/14 to file her motion.  MH set for 9/16/14 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
With Fran/Atty McGrath the FPT of 8/12/14 at 11am is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 8/13/14 at 8:15am.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Denise Hertz-McGrath. Clerk LE. Preliminary hearing held with co-def. 14CF564. KSD Deputy John Lanctot sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by co-def.'s attorney, Atty. Kristyne Watson, and Atty. Hertz-McGrath. Exhibit S-1 received into evidence. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6 for arraignment on 6-24-14 @ 8:15am with co-def. Information filed. Bond continued.
